Dear CAROL EVELYN-FRISKE BANKS:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on February 7, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing must include all the following:
• (b) An annual budget for the current fiscal
year.
The agency's budget was requested but was not provided as required.
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not

administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The agency's financial audit was requested but not provided as required.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (d) Three references obtained from
persons who are unrelated to the staff
person.
Two of two new employee files reviewed did not have 3 references obtained prior
to hire as required.
CPA Rule 400.12214 Compliance with the child protection law
• (1) An agency shall comply with the child
protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to
722.638.
Two of two new employee files reviewed did not have documentation the agency
was in compliance with the child protection law as they did not complete the
DCWL Children's Protective Services history review as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2/21/2024 INTERIM, CAP approved 4/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
• (3) An agency shall provide the licensee an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A
renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the
license.

One of three foster home files reviewed did not have documentation the renewal
application was provided to the foster parent at least 60 days prior to the
expiration of the license as required.
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
• (4) At least 1 adult member of the household
must have training in and maintain a current

resuscitation from the American Heart

institution approved by the department.

adult member of the household maintained current certification in CPR/First Aid

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Multiple areas of noncompliance were cited during the audit. The agency needs
to establish safeguards to ensure there is appropriate oversight to ensure
licensing rules are followed.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency interim inspection was completed on 2/21/2024 and the CAP approved on
4/19/2024. The agency was cited for 10 violations, 5 of which were repeated this
year. Of those 5, there was a slight improvement in individual incidents of non-
compliance within two of the violation areas and remaining 3 areas stayed the
same. In 2023, 3 violations were established, 1 of which was repeated this year.
The agency will need to establish additional corrective planning for the repeated
violations to ensure a reduction of incidents.
Special investigation 2025SIC0000109 was completed on 1/10/2025 and the CAP
is pending. The agency was found in non-compliance with PA 116 as a foster
youth's case record included information that was not truthful or accurate. The
agency is expected to comply with the action steps of their CAP once it is
approved.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated that there have been difficulties throughout the year due to not having
adequate, competent staff as well as frequent turnover. The assessment noted a
plan moving forward to address licensing requirements. She is confident there will
be noticeable improvement.
Financial Overview
Financial information was requested from the agency in the CPA letter as well as a
follow up email but was not provided.
Staff and Youth Interviews
An interview was conducted with one staff via teleconference. Staff reported the
agency has struggled with turnover and it has impacted overall compliance. They
have recently hired new staff and are hopeful they will show improvement over the
next review period.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The home has a swimming pool, and the house is used as a barrier.
The door leading to the pool is locked, but it is not out of reach of children, and it is
not self-latching/self-closing. In addition, the home is missing a smoke alarm
between the foster children's bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: The foster parents purchased a device that will allow the sliding glass
door leading to the pool to self-latch/self-close. A door alarm is used that is triggered
as soon as the door is open and has a unique sound from the other alarms in the
home. Photos were submitted as verification. A smoke detector was installed in the
proper location. A photo was submitted as verification.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
